Two former NSA agents blow the whistle on wiretapping US citizens. Although the Bush administration for years has stressed that new laws allowing eavesdropping are only used to listen in on phone conversations involving terrorist targets, the two former agents argue the opposite was true. They recount numerous stories where the eavesdropping involved normal U.S. citizens living abroad. One former agent recalls eavesdropped calls involving phone sex. Source: Truly Newsworthy, www.TrulyNewsworthy.com.
 
 It is no surprise that the American public has no faith in the Bush administratio.
